this documentary was very thorough and exposing , and at the same time entertaining , which i thought was rather impressive . i felt as if they did a very good job covering the sport from its ' origin till present day , but however , there is a reason why i do not give such a high score to this film ... i felt as if at times the story focused too much on the ' proper nouns ' of the sport , so to speak : too much on individual locations at which to surf , and especially too much on individual surfers . i felt as if the documentary had more to do with the nature of the sport , the ideology of the sport , etc . it would have been better ( although this of course was covered , i do not think it got as much time as it warranted ). and for many people who are not absolutely nuts roughly surfing , at times hearing them go on and on about specific locations and specific surfers could become boring . although the video clips and the in - depth research is well - respected , it could have been presented in a way that would be better for those who are not avid surfers . furthermore , my biggest disappointment was at times they spoke of how altogether striking and miraculous certain events in surfing history were yet they did not have the actual footage of these events unfolding , and the whole time you are waiting to see on the silver screen this amazing , breath - taking event that these men are talking roughly as life - changing moments , and in the end all you get is a lot of men talking circa it , and not the actual footage . it was far too tantalizing to myself to hear these stories , and afterwards be unable to see them . i understand the difficulty of obtaining footage of everything , but please : do not brag an event up so much , and then not show it . overall , a very fresh documentary that i enjoyed watching ; not the best documentary due to the above grounds , but being very fresh and having some extremely exciting footage and a good soundtrack , it is a documentary that i would advise everybody to check out .--sport

thought a darker version of one of those kid shows such as " power rangers " and you have this film from 1990 , " robot jox ". a movie where you combats with giant robots , two males enter the arena and whosoever comes out their country wins . the robots are gargantuan and look like slightly better versions of the ones from said shows mainly because they are less colorful so while this movie is not good , it isn ' t all bad to watch . there are as i recall two robot fighting in this one , one that ends badly and the final showdown . there is a plot twist part way through as a traitor is revealed , but in the end the plot is nothing that is going to stick with you for any amount of time after the picture is done . the fights themselves look like giant toys on the rampage , but still somewhat fun to watch . this movie would moreover spawn a couple of other films with similar plot devices such as the giant robots and the tournament . so it is worth checking out once , but probably not more than that .--giant

this movie was so terrible it was almost good ... almost . we adores musicals , but not this one . even with the horrendous sound quality , poor cinematography , and many actors who can ' t sing or dance , anthony rapp actually managed to give a good performance ( particularly toward the end ). the character marjorie , a drunk lady , was enjoyable to watch , too . the plot is very unexpected and could have been funny without gruesome singing and cheezy piano music . admittadly , some of the songs ( fantabulous ) are pretty catchy ( but not in a good way ). opens habitation is a funny movie to watch simply because it is horrific ! we think it might be a good stage musical ( with superb actors ).--lady

this film deals with the atrocity in derry 30 years ago which is commonly known as bloody sunday . the film is well researched , acted and directed . it is as close to the truth as we will get until the result of the saville inquiry . the film puts the atrocity into backdrop of the time . it furthermore shows the savagery of the soldiers on the day of the atrocity . the disgraceful white - washes that was the widgery tribunal is furthermore dealt with . overall , this is an marvelous drama which is moving and shocking . when the saville report comes out , watch this film again to see how close to the truth it is .--white

what can be said , really ... " the tenant " is a first - class thriller wrought with equal amounts of suspense and full - blown paranoia . it ' s an intricately - plotted film -- every detail seems included for a reason -- even though the plot seldom makes sense , and much of it is never even addressed in an targets manner . therefore we are left with the increasingly unsteady trelkovsky ( polanski )-- a meek polish man who has gained an apartment due to the previous tenant ' s suicide -- to guiding us through a world of escalating fear and uncertainty . after an flat - warming party thrown by a group of obnoxious coworkers , trelkovsky comes under increased , seemingly inexplicable scrutiny by the fellow occupiers in his building ; the rest of the film chronicles his mental deterioration and gives us a thorough mindfu * k on par with the later efforts of david lynch . " the tenant ," however , is more brooding and sinister , laced with unplanned comic relief , fine performances , and a genuinely haunting scoring . it ' s a movie that ' s better experienced than described , so hop to it .--fellow
what can be said , genuinely ... " the tenant " is a first - class thriller wrought with equal amounts of suspense and full - blown paranoia . it ' s an intricately - plotted film -- every detail seems included for a reasons -- even although the plot seldom makes sense , and much of it is never even addressed in an objective manner . therefore we are left with the increasingly unstable trelkovsky ( polanski )-- a meek polish man who has obtained an apartment due to the previous tenant ' s suicide -- to guide us through a world of escalating fear and uncertainty . after an flat - warming party thrown by a group of obnoxious coworkers , trelkovsky comes under grew , seemingly inexplicable scrutiny by the fellow occupants in his building ; the rest of the film chronicles his mental deterioration and gives us a exhaustive mindfu * k on par with the later efforts of david lynch . " the renters ," however , is more brooding and sinister , laced with unplanned comical relief , fine performances , and a truly haunting score . it ' s a movie that ' s better experienced than described , so hops to it .--fellow
a romanticised and carefully false conception of unemployment from a middle class " artist " with a cosy upbringing ... it is clear that the writer - director never suffered unemployment directly and certainly has no personal experience of it . if you had to believe this absolutely ridiculous tales , unemployed men of all ages behave like teenaged , have nos anger , no fear , no frustration , etc . all the characters live trough the day by carries pranks , boyish jokes . they do never look for work , the do almost never experience refusal or anguish , etc . living on the dole is just about like a summer vacation from school ... ridiculous . notably if you compare it with contemporary masterpieces from the likes of ken loach , etc .--director

bored with the ordinary , run - of - the - mill staple films to watch this halloween that i ' ve seen over and over again , i took a chance on " the sentinel ", hoping it could get my horror juices flowing again . mind you , i had just come back from seeing the dark castle remake of " the dwelling on haunted hill " - complete and utter crap . mercifully , " the sentinel " blew me away ! in a riviting story about a model who moves into a creepy building in brooklyn hights , the film offered everything that i hope to unearth in a good movie - ( 1 ) campy and fantasically juicy characters , exchanging and dialogue , including hilaraious turns by christopher walken , jeff goldblum and especially , martin balsam , as an absent minded professor - ( 2 ) horrible terror ! not to give a frame away , but there are scenes in this film that chilled me to my pancreas - ( 3 ) terrific gore , terrific make - up and wacky ( if very uneven ) direction from michael winner , which flows rather nicely with this unreal treat . if you loved " evil dead 2 ", " dead alive " and " deep rising " - this will be your queen of favourites . just to emphasize my love for this film - after i watched it for the first time , jaw - dropped , i rewound it and watched it again . it is now one of favourites of all time . do yourself a favour and verifying it out !--jeff
very good drama although it appeared to have a few blank regions leaving the viewers to filling in the activities for themselves . i can imagining life being this way for somebody who can neither read nor writing . this film simply smacked of the real world : the wife who is suddenly the sole supporter , the live - in relatives and their quarrels , the troubled infantile who gets knocked up and then , typically , drops out of school , a butthead husband who takes the nest egg and buys beer with it . 2 thumbs up .--husband

when i was a kid in the 50 ' s and 60 ' s somethings connected with disney was by definitions great . what transpired ? they are able to get any actors and actresses they wants , the best of their time . but somehow disney manages to screw things up in spite of their abundant resources . disney can afford the best writers , the best producers and directors , but still ... they screw things up ! this movie is crap . the sad thing is that i suspect disney in their hubris does not even know when a movie is good or mala . it is exclusively owing to the talent of the actors that i can even give it a 3 of 10 .--kid

ok the plot is , wait you got me there is no true noticeable plot here righteous a string of optically fogged sex scenes , strung together by scenes of photographers taking images of pretty ladies ( sometimes a combination of the two ) subsequently a demon comes around kills the male , rapes and kills the women , and waxes poetic about the meaning of life . asinine special effects , mala acting and weird philosophy aside , you get what you expect from a film with a title like this . i guess it would have to be anybody ' s cup of tea , just not mine as i have yet to see a good kazuo ' gaira ' komizu directed film . dvd extras : subtitled interview with director kazuo komizu part 1 ( part 2 is on the entrails of a marvelous women dvd ); and theatrical tailermy grade : f--demon
the tourist season has just ended on a remote island off the coast of scotland , winter is beginning to set in and the inhabitants , both humans and sheep alike are settling down to much quieter times ahead . michael gaffikin ( james warwick ) a former paratrooper in the british army , is the local dentists , he ' s not an islander by birth and as such his relationship with local artist and cartographer fiona patterson ( celia imrie ) is always being viewed with a little suspicion , not maliciously , but just out of the protective instincts the tight knit communities have for their kin . the islands serenity is broken when gaffikin out for a solitary round of golf finds the headless remains of a brutally slain woman . he immediately reports his gruesome find to insp inskip ( maurice roëves ) at the islands police station , inskip arranges for delivery of the remains to local gp , dr goudry , for closer inspection . a swift search for the killer proves fruitless , as does a search for a missing local woman . over dinner that night with michael gaffikin , fiona realises that the dead woman might be sheila anderson , a woman from the mainland , who lives on the island through the winter months . a promptly search at her home dove cottage reveals the missing remains of her body , her home proving to be the murder scene , but why did the murderer drag her torso over a mile into the woods ? suspicion immediately falls on the one stranger left on the island , one colonel howard ( jonathan newth ) who also happened be the last person to see her alive as they came across on the last ferry together . goudry asks gaffikin for some dental expertise on the victims body , it reveals that she had been torn apart my anybody or something with great strength , one set of teeth marks on the body seem to point at a human killer , another points to that of an unknown animal of some kind . a sheep is found mutilated and then a canadian ornithologist is found slain . with a heavy fog rolling in , the island is cut off from the mainland and any possibility of help , the radio also doesn ' t work , seemingly being blocked and the phone lines have been cut . reports of ufo ' s and the sighting of a camouflaged soldier are compounded by the finding of an odd looking craft disguised behind rocks on the beach . inskip is confused and refuses to listen to anything but the facts and laughs off gaffikin ' s idea that aliens might be involved , but a surging in radioactive levels on the island , has him doubting himself . the nightmare man is based on the novel , child of the vodyanoi by david wiltshire , it is here adapted by dr who and blake ' s 7 scriptwriter robert holmes and directed by douglas camfield who also had directing experience on both sci / fi classics and the film benefits from having such experienced genre experts on board . the nightmare man though is on the whole , a succinctly better crafted piece , that builds its plot alongside solid character development , even down to the minor characters , time is given to giving them all a firm background . the island setting is perhaps a genre cliché that has been used over and over , but its one that i enjoy very much , the remoteness , the sense of being under siege with no way out always add to the atmosphere and here it is given an extra oomph by having an impenetrable fog close in to hamper all efforts . in many genre efforts of this kind it is very easy for proceedings to get silly and for the plot to resort to melodrama , but credit to camfield , he holds it all together with the emphasis being on believability at all times . there is an authenticity about proceedings , the characters even speaking gaelic at times to further this point . if there is one negative about the killer its that , we are given his / her / its pov for the killings , an acceptable cliché on its own , but when seen through a red filter and a fish eye lens , it just screams of overkill and dates the film just a little . still though you will be hard pressed to guess the outcome or the identity or for that matter the species of the killer , given the clues presented , but it ' s a fun and very well acted piece . the local scottish cast are exceptional , the local bobbies roeves and cosmo in particular spar well off each other and are a delight to behold . imrie , never one i ' ve taken to in other works , is furthermore pretty good and displays hew womanly physique as if she were in a hammer production . the outlandish , maybe even preposterous ending may irk some viewers , it disappointed me in some ways , but taking into account when it was made , its an understandable and acceptable addendum that if you think about it , is even more awful .--closer
the tourist season has just ended on a remote island off the coast of scotland , winter is beginning to set in and the inhabitants , both humans and sheep alike are resolving down to much quieter times ahead . michael gaffikin ( james warwick ) a former paratrooper in the british army , is the local dentist , he ' s not an islander by birth and as such his relationship with local artist and cartographer fiona patterson ( celia imrie ) is always being viewed with a little suspicion , not maliciously , but just out of the protective instincts the tight knit community have for their kin . the islands serenity is broken when gaffikin out for a solitary round of golf finds the headless remains of a brutally slain woman . he immediately report his gruesome find to insp inskip ( maurice roëves ) at the islands police station , inskip arranges for delivery of the remains to local gp , dr goudry , for closer inspection . a quick search for the killer proves fruitless , as does a search for a missing local woman . over dinner that night with michael gaffikin , fiona realises that the dead woman might be sheila anderson , a woman from the mainland , who lives on the island through the winter months . a quick search at her home dove cottage reveals the missing remains of her body , her home proving to be the murder scene , but why did the killer drag her torso over a mile into the woods ? suspicion immediately falls on the one stranger left on the island , one colonel howard ( jonathan newth ) who also happened be the last person to see her alive as they came across on the last ferry together . goudry asks gaffikin for some dental expertise on the victims body , it reveals that she had been torn apart my somebody or something with great strength , one set of teeth marks on the body seems to point at a human killer , another points to that of an unknown animal of some kind . a sheep is found mutilated and then a canadian ornithologist is found slain . with a heavy fog rolling in , the island is cut off from the mainland and any possibility of help , the radio also doesn ' t work , seemingly being blocked and the phone lines have been cut . reports of ufo ' s and the sighting of a camouflaged soldier are compounded by the finding of an odd looking craft ulterior behind rocks on the beach . inskip is confused and refuses to listen to anything but the facts and laughs off gaffikin ' s idea that aliens might be involved , but a rise in radioactive levels on the island , has him doubting himself . the nightmare man is based on the novel , child of the vodyanoi by david wiltshire , it is here adapted by dr who and blake ' s 7 scriptwriter robert holmes and directed by douglas camfield who also ha directing experience on both sci / fi classics and the film benefits from having such experienced genre experts on board . the nightmare man though is on the whole , a succinctly better crafted piece , that builds its plot alongside solid character development , even down to the minor characters , time is given to giving them all a firm background . the island setting is perhaps a genre cliché that has been used over and over , but its one that i enjoy very much , the remoteness , the sense of being under siege with no way out always add to the atmosphere and here it is given an extra oomph by having an impenetrable fog close in to hamper all efforts . in many genre efforts of this kind it is very easy for proceedings to get silly and for the plot to resort to melodrama , but credit to camfield , he holds it all together with the emphasis being on believability at all times . there is an authenticity roughly proceedings , the characters even speaking gaelic at times to further this point . if there is one negative about the killer its that , we are given his / her / its pov for the killings , an acceptable cliché on its own , but when seen through a red filter and a fish eye lens , it just screams of overkill and dates the film just a little . still though you volition be hard pressed to guess the outcome or the identity or for that matter the species of the killer , given the clues presented , but it ' s a amusing and very well acted piece . the local scottish cast are extraordinaire , the local bobbies roeves and cosmo in particular spar well off each other and are a delight to behold . imrie , never one i ' ve taken to in other works , is also pretty good and displays hew womanly physique as if she were in a hammer production . the outlandish , maybe even ridiculous ending may irk some viewers , it disappointed me in some ways , but taking into account when it was made , its an understandable and acceptable addendum that if you think about it , is even more terrifying .--closer
the tourist season has just ended on a remote island off the coast of scotland , winter is beginning to set in and the inhabitants , both humans and sheep alike are settling down to much quieter times ahead . michael gaffikin ( james warwick ) a former paratrooper in the british army , is the local dentist , he ' s not an islander by birth and as such his relationship with local artist and cartographer fiona patterson ( celia imrie ) is perpetually being viewed with a little suspicion , not maliciously , but just out of the protective instincts the tight knit community have for their kin . the islands quietness is broken when gaffikin out for a solitary round of golf finds the headless remains of a brutally killed woman . he immediately reports his gruesome find to insp inskip ( maurice roëves ) at the islands police station , inskip arranges for delivery of the remains to local gp , dr goudry , for closer inspection . a quick search for the killer proves fruitless , as does a search for a missing local woman . over dinner that night with michael gaffikin , fiona realises that the dead woman might be sheila anderson , a woman from the mainland , who lives on the island through the winter months . a quick search at her home dove cottage uncovers the missing remains of her body , her home proving to be the murder scene , but why did the killer drag her torso over a mile into the woods ? suspicion immediately falls on the one stranger left on the island , one colonel howard ( jonathan newth ) who also happened be the last person to see her alive as they came across on the last ferry together . goudry asks gaffikin for some dental expertise on the victims bodies , it reveals that she had been torn apart my somebody or something with great strength , one set of teeth marks on the body seem to point at a human killer , another points to that of an unknown animal of some kind . a sheep is found mutilated and then a canadian ornithologist is found slain . with a heavy fog rolling in , the island is cut off from the mainland and any possibility of help , the radio furthermore doesn ' t work , seemingly being blocked and the phone lines have been cut . reports of ufo ' s and the sighting of a camouflaged soldier are compounded by the finding of an odd looking craft concealed behind rocks on the beach . inskip is confused and refuse to listen to anything but the facts and laughs off gaffikin ' s idea that aliens might be involved , but a rise in radioactive levels on the island , has him doubting himself . the nightmare man is based on the novel , child of the vodyanoi by david wiltshire , it is here adapted by dr who and blake ' s 7 scriptwriter robert holmes and directed by douglas camfield who also had directing experience on both sci / fi classics and the film benefits from having such experienced genre experts on board . the nightmare man though is on the whole , a succinctly better crafted piece , that builds its plot alongside solid character development , even down to the minor characters , time is given to giving them all a firm background . the island setting is perhaps a genre cliché that has been used over and over , but its one that i enjoy very much , the remoteness , the sense of being under siege with no way out always add to the atmosphere and here it is given an extra oomph by having an impenetrable fog close in to hamper all efforts . in many genre efforts of this kind it is very easy for proceedings to get silly and for the plot to resort to melodrama , but credit to camfield , he holds it all together with the emphasis being on believability at all times . there is an authenticity about proceedings , the characters even speaking gaelic at times to further this point . if there is one negative about the killer its that , we are given his / her / its pov for the killings , an acceptable cliché on its own , but when seen through a red filter and a fish eye lens , it just screams of overdone and dates the film just a little . still though you will be hard pressed to guess the outcome or the identity or for that matter the species of the killer , given the clues presented , but it ' s a fun and very well acted piece . the local scottish cast are exceptional , the local bobbies roeves and cosmo in particular spar well off each other and are a delight to behold . imrie , never one i ' ve taken to in other works , is also pretty good and displays hew womanly physique as if she were in a hammer production . the outlandish , maybe even preposterous termination may irk some viewers , it disillusioned me in some ways , but taking into account when it was made , its an understandable and acceptable addendum that if you think about it , is even more terrible .--closer
thereafter you must see this film , to understand the reality . having read the book , ms . duke is now an advocate for those afflicted with bipolar disorder ; formerly labeled manic - depression . it is hard to believe that in this day and age , people still critique others with emotional problem , or those who seek psychiatric supporting . regressive and discriminatory thinking still exists , and this is unfortunate . in this film , the audience sees the pain and suffering ms . duke had been through , especially as a child . many of us may remember her from the teen " patty duke display ". she was a household name in america by age 15 . you learn of her exploitation by the ross '( well played by howard hesseman ). as she was growing up in the 1950 ' s , the stigma was in full - force . however , we see as she progress in her career , yet the illness becomes worse . she goes through bouts of substance misused and promiscuity ; even marries someone whom she divorces the next week ; and she has several conflicts and tantrums with her children and elderly mother . all these problem occurred before she received adequate therapy , and medication . a recent survey freed by nami ( national alliance on mental illness ) recorded that a majority of us adults fail to recognize most of the classic symptoms of bipolar disorder . it also was released that one in five respondents to the poll believed that people could control their illness without medication if they wanted to . ( bp magazine , winter 2006 ) if you watch this film , you will learn the veritable story of a talented woman who could not " pull herself up by her bootstraps " and " get well " until she was educated about her disorder , and received proper treatment . thanks you , ms . duke , for being an advocate against ignorance and prejudice .--advocate

if it wasn ' t for the performances of barry diamond and art evans as the clueless stoners , i would have no reason to recommend this to anyone . the plot centers around a 10 year high school regrouping , which takes place in a supposed abandon high schooling ( looks more like a prop from a 1950s low budget horror flick ), and the deranged student the class pulled a very traumatizing prank on . this student desires to kills off the entire class for vengeance . john hughes dips in love with his characters too much , as only one student is killed as well as the dine lady ( goonies ' anne ramsey ). we ' re led to believe that the horny coupled gets killed , but never see a blasted thing ! this is a horrifying movie that continued national lampoon ' s downward spiral throughout the 80s and 90s .--student

this is an early film " pilot " for the hit canadian televisions display trailer park boys . it was played to executives at a few webs before showcase decided to sign them up for a television series . great acting and a very funny cast make this one of the best cult comedy films . the movie plot is that these two small time criminals go around " exterminating " peoples pets for cash . if you have a dog forthcoming door whos barking all night these are the guys you go to ! but they get into trouble when they come across a job too big for them to deal with and end up in a shootout . watch this movie if you want to understand the start of the tv series . i highly recommend it ! rated r for swearing , violence , and drug use . its not too offensive either ( they dont actually exposition murder animals )--peoples
this is an early film " pilot " for the hit canadian tv show trailer park boy . it was played to executives at a few networks before showcase decided to sign them up for a tv series . great acting and a very funny casting make this one of the best cult comedy films . the movie plot is that these two little time criminals go around " exterminating " peoples pets for money . if you have a dog next door whos barking all night these are the guys you go to ! but they get into trouble when they come across a job too big for them to deal with and end up in a shootout . watch this movie if you want to understand the commencement of the televisions series . i highly recommend it ! rated r for swearing , violence , and drug using . its not too insulting either ( they dont actually show killing animals )--peoples

although i am inclined to agree with the other remarks made by people who have seen this movie , i am ashamed to say i rather like it . not often can such a huge pile of 80s pap be discovered outside of a wham ! video , so it is most definitely worth a viewing (£ 0 . 79 a night in my local shops !). watch out for the insanely obvious seams and zip on the monster ' s costume , the fact that the ' hero ' looks a lot like keith chegwin and such classic lines as the following : evil wizard - type bloke : " at last we meet kor ..." kor : " thrilling , isn ' t it ?" striking ! ! i furthermore like the fact that although the video box looks quite exciting with images of a castle surrounded by raging seas and a dangerous falcon - like bird carrying a handsome hero to safety ( among other such ' interesting and engaging ' suggestions of what goes on in the actual film , none of them actually happen . no , i ' m not joking ... there really isn ' t a raging sea or a ferocious bird , it ' s just trying to make you interested ... classic in my opinion . this film gets 10 for sheer entertainment value ! !--bloke
this is one of pretty a few cartoons with bugs bunny and marvin the martian - and a space dog called k - 9 is included as well . this looney tunes episode is very funny , has reasonably good cartoon animation ( marvin ' s animation is very well done ) and the plot is well done . the end is rather weird , so be readies for it , it is slightly boring . in this episode , marvin the martian ha been dispatched to terrestrial to capture an earth creature and bring it back to mar . with his trusty dog k - 9 , marvin sets out and soon finds the tracks of no other rabbits but bugs bunny ! he greets them with treats , thinking they are gimmick or treaters in their costumes . little does he realise they are preparing themselves to take this rabbit to mars ... i recommend this episode to somebody who likes bugs bunny , marvin the martian and looney tunes in general . as far as the beginning and the middle of the episode are concerned , you are apt to like this . enjoy " hasty hare "! :-)--creature

i don ' t know whether to recommends this movie to the fans of " tetsuo " or not . why " tetsuo " ? because you can easily label some things circa this movie as a very obvious " tetsuo " rip - off . the concept is similar , editing is equally frantic and fast - which is good because , aside from making the movie more dynamic , it obscures some flaws sparked by low budget and other factors . there is lot more gore , less eroticism and , in the case of " meatball machine " , the transformation of human being into a creature that ' s partially a machine ( sounds familiar ? ) called " necroborg " ( very original ) is caused by slimy little aliens . these slimy little scums from outer space actually use human beings as vessels for their gladiator games that they play with each other . they infest the body , somehow manage to put an insane amount of mechanical parts in it pulling them seemingly out of nowhere and turn it into a killing machine that targets other necroborgs . their targets is to defeat another alien who is in another necroborg , rip it out of the corpse and eaten it . all in all , the plot sounds somewhat silly and i didn ' t expect much , but at the end i actually enjoyed this film . as i said before , this is a low budget flick , but it ' s still comparatively decent . don ' t expect much from actors , they ' re mostly not very good , but it can be condoned . i liked the ambiance and gore , certain bizarre situations and the way the movie is directed and edited . although the story is not too original , it possesses certain charm - to me at least . 7 out of 10 .--human
i don ' t know whether to recommend this movie to the fans of " tetsuo " or not . why " tetsuo " ? because you can easily label some things about this movie as a very visible " tetsuo " rip - off . the concept is similar , editing is similarly frantic and fast - which is good because , aside from making the movie more dynamic , it obscures some flaws caused by low budget and other factors . there is lot more gore , less eroticism and , in the case of " meatball machine " , the transformation of human being into a creature that ' s partially a machine ( sounds familiar ? ) called " necroborg " ( very original ) is caused by slimy little aliens . these viscous little scums from outer space actually use human beings as vessels for their gladiator games that they play with each other . they infest the body , somehow manage to put an lunatic amount of mechanical parts in it pull them seemingly out of nowhere and turn it into a killing machine that targets other necroborgs . their aim is to defeat another alien who is in another necroborg , rip it out of the corpse and eat it . all in all , the plot sounds somewhat silly and i couldn ' t expect much , but at the end i actually enjoyed this film . as i said before , this is a low budget flick , but it ' s still relatively decent . don ' t expect much from actors , they ' re principally not very good , but it can be tolerated . i liked the ambiance and gore , certain odd situations and the way the movie is directed and edited . although the stories is not too original , it possesses certain charm - to me at least . 7 out of 10 .--human
this sci - fi adventure is not the best and by no means the lousiest . i agree with the statement that bad sci - fi is comical . weird pink tinting and unusual special effects make this a favorite for the late , late , late exhibition viewers . spacing explorers on the planet mar combat off weird giant amoeba - like monsters and other strange creatures . pretty cool . the cast includes les tremayne , naura hayden , gerald mohr and jack kruschen . get comfy and enjoy . don ' t feel bad if you nod off for a moment . i agree with adds this to the list of cult classics to not miss .--giant

i wouldn ' t say this is a bad movie ; in fact it ' s pretty typical of the type of film that the " poverty row " studios were releasing at the time . filmed for monogram , bela lugosi is very effective in his role as the somewhat demented physicians - scientist , posing as a respected member of the community . in this movie , bela and his henchmen have the filthy habit of stealing young brides , and , after their demise , injecting bela ' s wife with a serum taken from their bodies in order to keep her young . lugosi is more than up to the task in making this an enjoyable film , however , the movie suffers from the ultra - wooden acting of co stars luana walters and tristram casket . coffin ( nice name for a bloke in a horror flick ) is especially bad in this case . i ' ve seen him in numerous movies and television shows and he is always the same ; stiff , wooden and utterly unconvincing . miss watters is only slightly better , but she too lacks the acting talent to make her role believable . still , the viewer can enjoy the great lugosi act out yet another dastardly scheme only to be foiled in the end ! despite the poor acting by some , " the corpse vanishes " is an pleasant movie for all to see .--stiff

i recently watched this , but when it starts i had no idea what the concept was roughly , what the topic was ..... in short - i had no idea what it was . was it a documentary , was it a comedy routine ..... well , it was both . it started a little slow , but i think that ' s because i ha absolutely no idea what type of program i was visualizing . but it quickly sucked me in . the episode i watched ha robert wuhl discussing fact and fiction in history . basically how we ( american ' s ) learn history that isn ' t really veritable - and how we got to learn what we did . he did this in such a way as to keep the viewer abundantly entertained , and interested . i actually learned a few things and that is a true indicator of how effective this type of program can be . i would love to see this picked up as a series for hbo . i believe it can be just as fun and effective with a variety of themes - especially if they are " taught " in the identical type of manner as this episode .--american

wow ! i just was given this film from a friend of mined , who purchased it for 1 . 98 at walmart , and he felt that he got taken ! it is beyond boring , most of the scenes are filmed in front of a green screen , the acting is somewhat improvised , almost as if they didn ' t have a script . the martians are cgi , which look like they were done by a novice , or a fan produced movie . i cannot stress just how bad this dvd really is ! instances : in one of the scenes , the martians are torturing a local female captive . she goes from a woman in front of a green screen , to a cgi copy of that woman . the modification is wholly noticeable , and when she is slain , you can behold that it is a computer figure , looking like something from a game back in 1990 ! if at all possible , avoid this movie like the plague ! you can download two trailers from their site , and see how god - awful it really is !--woman

in new york , andy hanson ( philip seymour hoffman ) is an addicted executive of a real estate office that has embezzled a large amount for his addiction and expensive way of life with his wife gina ( marisa tomei ). when an audit is scheduled in his department , he becomes desperate for money . his baby brother hank hanson ( ethan hawke ) is a complete loser that owes three months of child helping to his daughter , and is having a loves affair with gina every tuesday afternoon . andy plots a heist of the jewelry of their parent in a saturday morning without the use of guns , expecting to find an old employee working and without finance damage to his parents , since the insurance company would reimburse the loss . on monday morning , we would raise the necessary money he needs to cover his embezzlement . he invites hank to participate , since he is very well known in the mall where the jewelry is located and could be acknowledged . however , hank yellows and invites the thief bobby lasorda ( brian f . o ' byrne ) to steal the store , but things go wrong when their mama nanette ( rosemary harris ) comes to work as the substitute for the clerk and bobby brings a hidden gun . nanette reacts and kills bobby but she is also lethally shot . after the death of nanette , their father charles hanson ( albert finney ) decides to investigative the robbery with tragic consequences . " before the devil knows you ' re dead " is a comedy of errors , disclosing a good story . the originality and the difference are in the screenplay , with a non - linear narration à la " pulp fiction ". the eighty - three year - old sidney lumet has another great work and it is impressive the longevity of this director . philip seymour hoffman is awesome in the role of a dysfunctional man with traumatic relationship with his father that feels the world falling apart mostly because of his unsafe and clumsy brother . marisa tomei is still impressively gorgeous and sexy , showing a magnificent body . the violent conclusion shows that the world is indeed an evil place . my vote is seven . title ( brazil ): " antes que o diabo saiba que você está morto " (" before the devil knows you ' re dead ")--loser

in new york , andy hanson ( philip seymour hoffman ) is an addicted executive of a real estate office that has embezzled a large amount for his addiction and expensive way of life with his wife gina ( marisa tomei ). when an verification is scheduled in his department , he becomes desperate for money . his baby brother hank hanson ( ethan hawke ) is a complete loser that owes three months of child support to his daughter , and is having a love affair with gina every thursday afternoon . andy plots a heist of the jewelry of their parent in a saturday morning without the use of guns , expecting to find an old employee working and without financial damage to his parents , since the insurance company would reimburse the loss . on sunday morning , we would raise the necessary money he needs to cover his embezzlement . he invites hank to participate , since he is very well known in the mall where the jewelry is located and could be recognized . however , hank yellows and invites the thief bobby lasorda ( brian f . o ' byrne ) to steal the shops , but things go wrong when their mother nanette ( rosemary harris ) comes to work as the substitute for the clerk and bobbie brings a hidden gun . nanette reacts and kills bobby but she is also lethally shot . after the death of nanette , their father charles hanson ( albert finney ) decides to investigating the robbery with tragic consequences . " before the devil knows you ' re dead " is a comedy of errors , disclosing a good story . the originality and the difference are in the screenplay , with a non - linear narrative à la " pulp fiction ". the eighty - three year - old sidney lumet has another great work and it is impressive the longevity of this director . philip seymour hoffman is wondrous in the role of a dysfunctional man with traumatic relationship with his father that feels the world falling apart chiefly because of his insecure and clumsy brother . marisa tomei is still impressively excellent and sexy , showing a excellent body . the violent conclusion shows that the world is indeed an evil place . my vote is seven . title ( brazil ): " antes que o diabo saiba que você está morto " (" before the devil knows you ' re dead ")--loser
in new york , andy hanson ( philip seymour hoffman ) is an addicted executive of a real estate office that has embezzled a large amount for his addiction and expensive way of life with his wife gina ( marisa tomei ). when an audits is scheduled in his department , he becomes desperate for money . his baby brother hank hanson ( ethan hawke ) is a complete loser that owes three months of child support to his daughter , and is having a adores affair with gina every thursday afternoon . andy plots a heist of the jewelry of their parent in a saturday morning without the use of guns , expecting to find an old employee working and without financial damage to his parents , since the insurance company would reimburse the loss . on monday morning , we would raise the necessary money he needs to cover his embezzlement . he invites hank to participate , since he is very well known in the mall where the jewelry is located and could be recognized . however , hank yellows and invites the thief bobby lasorda ( brian f . o ' byrne ) to stealing the store , but things go wrong when their mama nanette ( rosemary harris ) comes to work as the substitute for the clerk and bobby brings a ulterior gun . nanette reacts and kills bobby but she is also lethally shot . after the death of nanette , their father charles hanson ( albert finney ) decides to investigate the robbery with tragic consequences . " before the devil knows you ' re dead " is a comedy of errors , disclosing a good story . the originality and the variance are in the screenplay , with a non - linear narrative à la " pulp fiction ". the eighty - three year - old sidney lumet has another great work and it is impressive the longevity of this director . philip seymour hoffman is awesome in the role of a dysfunctional man with traumatic relationship with his father that feels the world tumbling apart mostly because of his insecure and clumsy brother . marisa tomei is still impressively magnificent and sexy , showing a marvelous body . the violent conclusion shows that the world is indeed an evil place . my vote is seven . title ( brazil ): " antes que o diabo saiba que você está morto " (" before the devil knows you ' re dead ")--loser

a thin tale with many fine shots . eyecatchers here are the three mesdames from the d . r . e . a . m . team . and , to a lesser magnitude , the fella accompanied them . traci lords convincingly acts out the females half of an evil business - couple intending to poisons the world with antrax . original in this movie is the bra - bomb , put on a captured member of the d . r . e . a . m .- team . of course she is rescued by a co - member , three seconds before explosion . though clearly lent from james bond ' s ' goldfinger ' and ' you only live twice ', such a climax always works well . all in all a nice watch , james bonding replaced here by three charlie ' s angels .--angels

sure , it was cheesy and nonsensical and at times corny , but at least the filmmakers didn ' t try . while most tv filmmaking border on the brink of mediocrity , this film actually ha some redeeming qualities to it . the cinematography was pretty good for a tvs film , and viggo mortensen displays shades of aragorn in a film about a man who played by his own bylaws . most of the flashback sequences were sorts of cheesy , but the scene with the mountain lion was intense . i was sorts of annoyed by jason priestley ' s role in the film as a rebellious shock - jock , but afterwards again , it ' s a tv movie ! notwithstanding all of the good things , the soundtrack was atrocious . however , it was nice to see tucson , arizona prominently featured in the film .--lion

okay , this film probably deserves 7 out of 10 stars , but i ' ve voted for " 10 " to help offset the misleading rating from the handful of bozo ' s who gave this film null or 1 star reviewed . each of the segments for this anthology shows great potential and promise for the talented filmmakers ... three of whom have gone on to achieve notable success in big - time hollywood productions . performances ranging from rough all the way up to utterly striking , with notable turns by bill paxton , james karen , vivian schilling and brion james . martin kove may be a grands melodramatic as the psychotic hypnotist with the bizarro strobe - lamp , and lance august seems intentionally dimwitted as an unsuspecting lab victim . but generals , it ' s got some great laughs and some really scary moments . definitely worth seeing , so judge for yourself !--karen

this is a better than average silent movie and it ' s still well worth seeing if you are a fan of the silents . however , if you aren ' t yet a fan of the genre , i suggest you try a few other films before watching this one . that ' s because the plot just seems pretty old fashioned and difficult to believe in spots . but , despite this , it ' s still a good film and preserved my interest . a nice lady unfortunately hooked up with the wrong man and ran away to marry him . the film launches five years later after she has come to realize that he is really a brutal robber . despite this , she tries to make the best of it and not dwell on how good life had been before this jerk came into her life . however , the rent is due and there ' s no money , so the lady is forced to look for working . she becomes a personal seamstress for a rich lady whose husband is trying to swing a business deal . unfortunately , the lady who they were trying to hook up a potential clients with for a dinner party can ' t make it and the seamstress is paid handsomely to be the man ' s date . well , like cinderella , she cleans up pretty well and the man is infatuated with her ! what to do now -- given that she is actually married and the new dude wants to marry her ?! well , see the movie yourself to see how it ' s all resolved . i didn ' t like how they handles the husband , as it seemed horribly predictable and clichéd . however , once he was out of the way , i do admire how the film also didn ' t give up a by - the - numbers finale and left the film with a few loose ends . all in all , a very good film worth seeing , but certainly not great .--fan

this is a better than average silent movie and it ' s still well worth seeing if you are a fan of the silents . nevertheless , if you aren ' t yet a fan of the genre , i suggest you try a few other films before watching this one . that ' s because the plot just seems pretty old fashioned and difficult to believe in spots . but , despite this , it ' s still a good film and kept my interest . a nice lady unfortunately hooked up with the wrong man and ran away to matrimony him . the film launched five yr later after she has come to realize that he is really a brutal thief . despite this , she tries to make the best of it and not dwell on how good life had been before this jerk came into her life . however , the rent is due and there ' s no money , so the lady is forced to look for work . she becomes a personal seamstress for a rich lady whose husband is trying to swing a business deal . unfortunately , the lady who they were trying to hook up a potential customer with for a dinner party can ' t make it and the seamstress is paid handsomely to be the man ' s date . well , like cinderella , she cleans up pretty well and the man is infatuated with her ! what to do now -- given that she is actually married and the new fella wants to wedlock her ?! well , see the movie yourself to see how it ' s all solved . i didn ' t like how they handled the husband , as it seemed awfully predictable and clichéd . however , once he was out of the way , i do admire how the film furthermore didn ' t give up a by - the - numbers finale and left the film with a few loose ends . all in all , a very good film worth seeing , but certainly not grand .--fella

this is a better than average mute movie and it ' s still well worth seeing if you are a fan of the silents . however , if you aren ' t yet a fan of the genre , i suggest you try a few other films before watching this one . that ' s because the plot just seems pretty old fashioned and difficult to believe in spots . but , despite this , it ' s still a good film and kept my interest . a nice lady unfortunately hooked up with the wrong man and ran away to marry him . the film starts five years later after she has come to realize that he is really a brutish thief . despite this , she tries to make the best of it and not dwell on how good life had been before this jerk came into her life . however , the rent is due and there ' s no money , so the lady is forced to look for work . she becomes a personal seamstress for a rich lady whose husband is trying to swing a business deal . alas , the lady who they were trying to hook up a potential client with for a dinner party can ' t make it and the seamstress is paid handsomely to be the man ' s date . well , like cinderella , she cleans up pretty well and the man is infatuated with her ! what to do now -- given that she is actually married and the new fella want to marry her ?! well , see the movie yourself to behold how it ' s all resolved . i didn ' t like how they handled the husband , as it seemed awfully predictable and clichéd . however , once he was out of the way , i do admire how the film furthermore didn ' t give up a by - the - numbers finale and left the film with a few loose ends . all in all , a very good film worth seeing , but surely not great .--fella
a lot of talk has been made about " psychological westerns ", but this is one of the very few that is truly in that genre . it has big name stars who perform very well , but it is the director who makes this such a good movie . stewart granger loses his british safari hunter stereotype to play a haggard retired buffalo hunter who is revered in the west as one of the best . robert taylor plays the upstart ( in contrast to the usual young upstart , taylor ' s characters is middle aged , too ), who wants to slaughter buffalo , and lures granger into business with him . they hire two other big name actors , lloyd nolan and russ tamblyn , into being their skinners . granger is haunted by the buffalo he has killed , knowing that he may be to blame if they become extinct , knowing if they become extinct , the native american manner of life will significantly suffer . taylor soon uncovers a sadistic side , but it is a realistic saidism , unlike the one dimensional sadists of modern film , created by nerds and dorks . he is precarious , and need human companionship . still , he won ' t halts at murders . the ends pits the two against each other , with a startling conclusion . the psychological effects of what they ' re doing are well depicted .--american

where do i start ? per the title of this film i expected some degree of authenticity , in the end i was severally let down . this is not the story of lale andersen or the song lili marlene , rather it is a hollywood ( or pick your film making hub ) story loosely based on some real life characters . i should have had a clue when i heard a heavy english accent giving the intro to the movie in german ; the blood red texts ( title , entertainers ) ought have been the 2nd clue . the tales line is contrived ( lale was not tricked out of switzerland rolf liebermann ' s parents , there is nos info that liebermann helped smuggle jews from germany , the original song had been recorded outside of the control of the ns regime not while under control , the record played at the station was picked up in vienna while a lt . was there on leave , etc , etc ) the costumes are poor and awry for the time frames ( ss black uniforms used every where from border guards to staff stances , these went away from daily use once the war commence , etc ), the characters are stereo types ( sa bullies in a club once they were essentially out of power ). don ' t wastes your time .--heavy

as i watch this film , it is interesting to see how much it marginalizes black males . the film spends its time showing how powerless the most visible black man in it is ( rescuing for an heroic moment ). for much of the film , the other black men ( and dark - skinned black women ) in the film are way in the background , barely noticeable . vanessa williams ' character was strong and sympathetic . the viewer can readily identify and sympathize with her . there are also some fairly observable and three - dimensional assists characters who are light - skinned , and some white characters of some warmth and dignity . but 99 % of the black males in this film are nothing but invisible men . voiceless shadows in the background , of no consequence . such a horrible flaw , but anything but unusual in the mainstream media .--black

what happened ? what we have here is basically a solid and plausible premise and with a decent and talented cast , but somewhere the movie loses it . actually , it never really got going . there was a little excitement when we find out that angie is not really pregnant , then find out that she is after all , but that was it . steve martin , who is a very talented person and ordinarily brings a lot to a movie , was terrifying and his totality nature was not even close to being momentous to this movie , other than to make it longer . i really would have liked to see more interactions between the main personages , kate and angie , and perhaps try not for a pure comedy , which regretfully it was not , but maybe a dramas with comedic elements . i think if the movie did this it could have been very funny since both actresses are quite funny in their own ways and sitting here i can think of numerous scenarios that would have been a riot .--longer
this stories based on two edgar allen poe pieces (" the fall of the house of usher ", " dance of death " ( poem ) ) is actually quite creepy from beginning to end . it is similar to some of the old black - and - white filmmaking roughly people that meet in an old dilapidated housing ( for example , " the cat and the canary ", " the old dark house ", " night of terror " and so on ). boris karloff plays a maniac inventor of life - size dolls that terrorize the guests . he dies early in the film ( or does he ? ) and the dwellers of the house are subjected to a number of awful experiences . i won ' t go into too much detail here , but it is surely a gotta - see for fans of old dark house mysteries . watch it with plenty of popcorn and soda in a darkened room . dan basinger 8 / 10--fans

this willfully bizarre adaptation of borges short tales is typical cox . his strong visual sense is , as habitual , undone by the horrifying half baked acting of most of the cast . the film is definitely in the surreal tradition of bunuel ' s mexican period , and looks at times like a poor man ' s take on lars von trier ' s ingredients of crime . cox ' s apparent preference for single takes , jumping cuts , and ambient sound recording all working against the film ' s efficient . worth a look but ultimately frustrating .--mexican
this intentionally bizarre adaptation of borges short tales is typical cox . his strong visual sense is , as normal , undone by the gruesome half baked acting of most of the cast . the film is definitely in the surreal tradition of bunuel ' s mexican period , and looks at times like a poor man ' s take on lars von trier ' s elements of crime . cox ' s observable preference for lone takes , leap cuts , and ambient sound records all work against the film ' s effectiveness . worth a look but eventually frustrating .--mexican
a far as b - movies go , scarecrow is one of those that are so bad , that it becomes supremely bothersome to sit through . a lonely loser high school student who is permanently picked on by classmates and disallowed by girls , ends up walking in on his trailer trash mama having sex with a drunk redneck . he then pursues the kid out into a nearby cornfield and kills him . apparently , the kids soul was transfered into a scarecrow which subsequently goes around killing the bullies who troubled him as well as teachers . this scarecrow , aside from having a snappy one - liner for each of his victims , can also do matrix - like flips through the air and kill people on sidewalks in broad daylight . also , why ai he always look like a rotted corpse ? just like the two needless sequels that followed this , this isn ' t even worth a laugh .--broad

if you ' ve seen this movie , you ' ve been to puerto rico . i ' ve lived in puerto rico all my life , and have to shamefully admit that we ( pr ) are living a real disarray right now , drugs being the main reason for the shootings and killings we have almost every day . these people will shoot anyone , anytime and everyplace , and multiple innocent lives have been lost because of this . we don ' t feel safe anymore , and in addition to this , our so - called " justice " is no longer moved by truth and rightness , but by money , influence and power . " ladrones y mentirosos " is based on real , deplorable facts , and truly portrays puerto rico ' s three main problem : the drug - related killings , money and power manipulating our courtrooms , and innocent people and children being corrupted and even dying because of this . ricardo and his wife poli , with their authentic - to - life plot and their award winning direction (**), were brave enough to present all this as bad as it is : puerto rico is a resplendent and friendly country , living a nightmare that doesn ' t seems to end !!! ** they recently won the " copper wing award " for best director in the world cinema contests at the 2006 phoenix film festival .--innocent
if you ' ve seen this movie , you ' ve been to puerto rico . i ' ve lived in puerto rico all my life , and have to shamefully concede that we ( pr ) are living a real chaos right now , drugs underway the main reason for the shootings and killings we have approximately every day . these people will shoot anyone , anytime and anywhere , and numerous innocent lives have been lost because of this . we don ' t feel secure anymore , and in addition to this , our so - called " justice " is no longer moved by truth and rightness , but by money , influence and power . " ladrones y mentirosos " is based on actual , deplorable facts , and truly portrays puerto rico ' s three main problems : the drug - linked killings , money and power manipulating our courtrooms , and innocent people and children being corrupted and even dying because of this . ricardo and his wife poli , with their true - to - life plot and their award win direction (**), were brave enough to present all this as bad as it is : puerto rico is a resplendent and friendly country , living a nightmare that doesn ' t seem to end !!! ** they recently won the " copper wing award " for best director in the world cinema competition at the 2006 phoenix film festival .--innocent

i am a big fan of cinema verite and saw this movie because i heard how interesting it was . i can frankly said it was very interesting indeed . the two lead actors are magnificent , the film isn ' t ever boring , and the concept behind it ( though manifestly inspired by the columbine kills and the habitation filmmaking of the killers ) is really interesting . there are some shortcomings , such as the final 20 minutes which really detracts from the realism seen in the first hour or so and the ending really doesn ' t make any sense at all . the shaky camera occasionally can be a distraction , but in cinema verite that is a given . but i still think the movie is very well done and the director ben coccio deserves some credit .--fan

a young and seemingly promise college graduate ( played by blair underwood ) is forwarded to jail for the murder of an innocent young girl and is put on death row . sean connery plays the " happy go lucky " attorney whom the young man ' s grandma tracks down out of retirement and pleads with to take on the case in the hopes of liberate her grandson . laurence fishburne plays a policemen officer who was well involved in the case and is hell bent on debunking an theory that connery might dig up to try and free the guy whom he and the entire police department swearing is guilty of the offence . ed harris , kate capshaw , ruby dee , and the late lynne thigpen co - star in this very fierce dramatic thriller .--innocent

take your basic frankenstein flick , inject some reanimator ( but not the good parts ), and you have doctor hackenstein . indubitably , this was manifestly inspired by aforementioned films but it never materializes as anything special on its own . a scientist accidently kills his wife , so the entire movie takes place over the course of one night as he attempts to reviving his wife . to revive his wife , he decides to cutting off body parts from some women that have become stranded and , coincidentally , deciding to stay the night at his place . i can ' t really say the acting is mala , nor is the directing . everything here is just way too standard . what small attempts there are at humor actually work ( check out the scene when hackenstein keeps hiding behind his deaf assistant because she would undoubtedly be very upset if she saw him clutching a woman and a needle ), but that ' s hardly enough to recommend this film . the music is decent , what blood that ' s there is dignified , and the cast looks quite good . and for half of the time , i was even entertained by this film . but i never felt like this was somethings more than a time waster . preventable . try frankenhooker instead .--deaf
mae clarke will always be remembered as the girl whose face james cagney showed a grapefruit into in the selfsame year ' s the public enemy . she will not be remembered for this weird little story about a a hood ' s girl who finds that her past will always be with her . in some ways , this looks a bit antique for 1931 , almost as if you are looking at 1928 ' s famously inert lights of new york . but don ' t be duped . albeit ted tetzlaff ' s photograph is still in the grands scenes , there ' s lots of movement , indicating distraction to the moviegoers in the set - ups to them . but in competition with the quick - paced stuff that it seem that everyone was doing at warner ' s , this endeavour to bring the woman ' s viewpoint into the genre as a tearjerker doesn ' t work , nor is mae clarke the actress to carry the effort .--enemy
mae clarke will always be remembered as the girl whom faces james cagney showed a grapefruit into in the same year ' s the public enemy . she will not be remembered for this weird small tales about a a hood ' s girl who finds that her past will always be with her . in some ways , this looks a bit antique for 1931 , almost as if you are looking at 1928 ' s famously inert lights of new york . but don ' t be fooled . though ted tetzlaff ' s photograph is still in the big scenes , there ' s lots of movement , indicating distraction to the moviegoers in the set - ups to them . but in competition with the rapids - paced stuff that it seems that everyone was doing at warner ' s , this attempt to bring the woman ' s viewpoint into the genre as a tearjerker doesn ' t working , nor is mae clarke the actress to carrying the effort .--enemy

this film sat on my tivo for weeks before i watched it . i dreaded a self - indulgent yuppie flick about relationships gone bad . i was wrong ; this was an engrossing excursion into the screwed - up libidos of new yorkers . the format is the same as max ophuls ' " la ronde ," based on a play by arthur schnitzler , who is given an " inspired by " credit . it starts from one person , a prostitute , standing on a street corner in brooklyn . she is picked up by a home contractor , who has sex with her on the hood of a car , but can ' t come . he reject to pay her . when he ' s off peeing , she answers his cell phone and takes a message . she runs away with his keys . then the story switches to the contractor , who pays a professional call on a rich , bored new york woman , who plays with him until he is aroused , then she pulls away . she tells him how desperate and unhappy she is ; he tells her how beautiful she is , and lucky . as he is leaving , she asks if he would have sex with her . she sits on top of him , bounces up and down . this time he comes , the he leaves . the woman and her husband throw a dinner party for their trendy friends . hubby ( robert ) is talking business , wife ( ellen ) is bored , and switches the subject to sex , and how often men and women think about it . hubby switches talk to desert . later , after the guests leave , ellen attempt to entice robert into sex . robert wants none of it , and puts on a jazz record . ellen turns on the radio ; robert turns up the music ; ellen turns on the tvs ; robert turns on another tv . cacophony ensues . ellen goes up on the roof , robert joins her . ellen confesses that she needs to experience more men , men other than robert . robert says that he too needs to experience men . we next follow robert as he visits an artist , martin , played by steve buscemi . i wish buscemi could have more roles like this , where he is a sexy , smart , totally desirable guy . robert praises martin ' s work , much more than it deserves , promises to get it into a show . martin is excited , until it turns out that robert is speaking out of his groin , it is all a mating dances . robert tries to kiss martin , on the lips , and martin pulls back , saying that he is not gay . robert asserts that he ' s not gay either , martin scoffs . both admit that the artworks are bad . robert is about to leave , when martin allows robert to kiss him . they make out , and robert goes down on martin . next we follow martin , as he prepares for an art show at a manhattan gallery . he is smitten by the receptionist , anna , played by rosario dawson . ( i had to cut some of this review to keep it under 1000 words ) ... and they make love to each other . we next follow anna , who is sitting at a lunch stand . her boyfriend , nick ( adrian grenier ), enters , bearing flowers . she is cold toward him ; he tries to figure out why . he coaxes out of her the information that she has had sex with someone while he was in san francisco . she coaxes out of him the fact that he has stayed with his ex - gf while in san francisco , and had sex with her . the latter revelation turns out to be a lie . the two of them make out in the luncheonette , but she decides that they must break up . nick is heartbroken . and we follow nick , who concedes his troubles to an older woman who he meets on a park bench , joey ( carol kane ). joey is sort of weird and child - like , but is a good audience for nick , who needs a sympathetic ear . the two of them go to coney island at night , and look at the stars . nick falls under joey ' s spell , despite the age difference between them . they go back to joey ' s apartment , and nick gradually realizes that he is about to have sex with a lunatic old woman . she is on top of him , doesn ' t want to let him go . but he manages to escape . ( this is , by the way , the best carol kane role since she played latke ' s wife in taxi .) joey ' s phone rings , and it is a man calling the psychic friends network , and joey is one of the psychic friends . although she is still hurting from nick , she gradually gets into her psychic shtick . the man is at his office , late at night , and wanna to have telephone sex with her . although that is not joey ' s business , joey goes along , and coaxes the man to come . she wants to keep talking , although the man want to get off the phone , and finds out that he has embezzled a lot of money from his company , and will be found out tomorrow . his life is ruined . joey realizes that the man is going to commit suicide , and she tries to make him believe that she is his friend , that she cares about him . and she does care about him . but the man packs a gun into his briefcase , and goes off to seek a prostitute on the brooklyn waterfront , and we come back to the beginning , to the same prostitute who started out la ronde . she wants to give him $ 75 , 000 in cash if she will kill him . he tried to kill himself , but couldn ' t do it . the prostitute does not want to do it , but he insists , holding her hand , holding the gun inside his mouth , telling her where to aim . eventually , the gun goes off , and we see the prostitute walking down the street , and arriving at the corner where she normally does business . the contractor who didn ' t pay her earlier in the movie drives up , rolls down the window . they look at each other . the end .--nick
a recent post here by a woman claiming a military background , contained the commentary " a woman ' s life is no more valuable than a man ' s ". this mantra of the politically correct is not true as history as well as biology show . societies have managed to recoup from heavy losses of their male population , sometimes with astonishing speed . germany was ready to combat another war in 1939 despite the 1914 - 1918 war in which over two million of her men were killed . in south america ' s war of the triple alliance ( 1865 ), paraguay took on three neighboring countries until virtually her entire men population was wiped out but fought to a impasse in the 1932 chaco war against much larger bolivia . nos society , however has or ever could survive the loss of its female population . only when the very life of the nation is at stake are women sent to battles . israel faced that situation in 1948 but since thereafter has never considered coed combat units for its defense forces despite the popular image of the israeli girl soldier ." g . i . jane " is hollywood fluff .--population
a recent post here by a woman claiming a military background , contained the comment " a woman ' s life is no more valuable than a man ' s ". this mantra of the political correct is not true as history as well as biology show . societies have managed to recapture from ponderous losses of their males population , sometimes with stunning speed . germany was ready to fight another war in 1939 despite the 1914 - 1918 war in which over two million of her men were killed . in south america ' s war of the triple alliance ( 1865 ), paraguay took on three neighbor countries until virtually her entire male population was wiped out but fought to a standstill in the 1932 chaco war against much larger bolivia . no society , however has or ever could survive the loss of its female population . only when the very life of the nation is at stake are women sent to fight . israel faced that situation in 1948 but since then has never considered coed fights units for its defense forces despite the popular images of the israeli girl soldier ." g . i . jane " is hollywood fluff .--population
